definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
family with a literary reputation (idiom); literary family

sentences.english: The ink paper, filled with long book, full of deep memory.
sentences.chinese: 淡墨紙，瀰漫着悠悠書香，滿是濃濃記憶。

sentences.english: Bai Bohua, born in Beijing in 1944 to a literary family.
sentences.chinese: 白伯驊，1944年出生於北京的一個書香世家。

sentences.english: May the aroma of books seep into our lives, and thereby changes cruelty and violence into peace and gentleness.
sentences.chinese: 讓書香化爲生命的馨香，讓暴戾兇殘化爲祥和溫柔。

sentences.english: Campus rational layout and beautiful environment, with rich, sophisticated atmosphere of the campus.
sentences.chinese: 校園佈局合理，環境優美，擁有濃郁的書香校園氣氛。

sentences.english: The books are free there, and it smells great.
sentences.chinese: 看書是免費的，而且書香宜人。

sentences.english: Floor VIP room: designed with Zen and appears Jingya, indoor scholarly atmosphere rich.
sentences.chinese: 設計具有禪意而顯得靜雅，室內書香氣息濃郁。

sentences.english: All the custom-made wood furniture in the study room go hand-in-hand.
sentences.chinese: 訂製的木傢俱，是表現書香的靈魂。

sentences.english: Let the books infiltrate the campus, let the classics accompany the childhood.
sentences.chinese: 讓書香浸潤校園，讓經典陪伴童年。

sentences.english: With wafts of the science book kissing me I bought it without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 這本科技書書香撲面，我毫不猶豫地買下來了。

sentences.english: We became a people of the book.
sentences.chinese: 由此說來，我們成了書香民族。

sentences.english: Liu Yusheng language is very talented, "full of book aroma."
sentences.chinese: 柳愉生語言天賦很高，人如其名充滿了書香氣。

sentences.english: Elegant doors first two were born in the family, was known to Expo will book group.
sentences.chinese: 兩位都出生在書香門第的家庭，幼時便以博覽羣書。

sentences.english: We breathe but the air of books.
sentences.chinese: 書香彷彿空氣，無處不在。

sentences.english: Although you are from a family of scholar, parents have a certain reputation.
sentences.chinese: 你雖出自書香門第，父母親是有一定的知名度。

sentences.english: When I was in elementary school the school held a "scholarly campus" activities.
sentences.chinese: 在我上小學時，學校舉辦了一個“書香校園”活動。

sentences.english: Fragrance flavor of ink and books spreads throughout the campus.
sentences.chinese: 這裏書香還包括墨香，故以書墨合之。

definition: appreciation of the finer things in life
the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
south of the five ranges/old term for south China, esp. Guangdong and Guangxi
Chinese national culture/studies of ancient Chinese civilization/the Imperial College (history)
to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
